explanation:
To determine whether lfs_dir_traverse_filter violates the MISRA recursion rule, we must examine every function it calls (and their callees) to see if any call chain returns to lfs_dir_traverse_filter.

- lfs_tag_isdelete: direct callee of lfs_dir_traverse_filter. Must be inspected to ensure it does not (directly or indirectly) call back into lfs_dir_traverse_filter.
- lfs_tag_type1: direct callee. Include to verify it does not call back into the target.
- lfs_tag_id: direct callee. Include to verify it does not call back into the target.
- lfs_tag_splice: direct callee. Include to verify it and its callees do not form a cycle back to the target.
- lfs_tag_chunk: callee of lfs_tag_splice. Included to follow the transitive call chain started by lfs_tag_splice and ensure no indirect recursion to lfs_dir_traverse_filter occurs.

(Other lexical tokens/macros in the function are not function calls and therefore not relevant to checking call/recursion cycles.)
